summary: Micro tools hub app featuring: QR Code Generator, Password Generator, Image Resizer, Unit Converter, Random Name Generator, plus AdSense ad placements (top and bottom banners) for monetization.
architectural_notes: Monetization via ads: integrate Google AdSense (browser-side script) and render two ad slots (top and bottom banners) across the app or key pages.

existing_features.title: Create a Micro Tools Hub home screen that lists and navigates to these tools: QR Code Generator, Password Generator, Image Resizer, Unit Converter, and Random Name Generator.
Implement a QR Code Generator tool that allows users to enter text/URL and generate a QR code preview, with an option to download the QR code image.
Implement a Password Generator tool with configurable options (length, include uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols) and a one-click copy-to-clipboard action.
Implement an Image Resizer tool that lets users upload an image, resize by width/height (with optional aspect ratio lock), preview the result, and download the resized image.
Implement a Unit Converter tool covering common categories with two-way conversion: at minimum Length, Weight/Mass, Temperature, and Volume.
Implement a Random Name Generator tool that generates one or multiple random names with basic configuration (count and style/type), and supports copy to clipboard.

Apply a cohesive, creative visual theme across the hub and all tool pages (color palette, typography, spacing, and components) and keep it consistent throughout the app (avoid blue & purple as the primary palette).

Add the provided Google AdSense loader script to the global HTML entry point so it loads once for the entire app.

Use this exact snippet (unchanged):

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js?client=ca-pub-9284074903614668"
     crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

Add two banner ad placement areas: one near the top of the app content and one near the bottom.

- The top banner must render below the header and above the main page content.
- The bottom banner must render above the footer.
- Each banner area must be visually distinct but unobtrusive, responsive, and reserve space to minimize layout shift.
- Include minimal, user-facing placeholder labeling in English (e.g., "Advertisement") within the banner area so the placement is visible even before ad units are configured.
Update the app footer so the copyright year is generated dynamically from the userâ€™s current date at runtime (instead of a hard-coded year), to keep the live site accurate over time.

Add a concise deployment guide for publishing the app to the Internet Computer mainnet (live), including build/deploy commands, environment/network selection, and a short post-deploy verification checklist.

Complete the existing deployment guide at frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md so it contains a full, runnable set of steps to deploy the app to the Internet Computer mainnet (live), including build/deploy commands, environment/network selection, and a short post-deploy verification checklist.
